etymologies: Old English alor, aler, of Germanic origin; related to German Erle; forms spelled with d are recorded from the 14th century

definitions: a widely distributed tree of the birch family which has toothed leaves and bears male catkins and woody female cones.

notes.text: Genus Alnus, family Betulaceae: many species

shortDefinitions: widely distributed tree of birch family which has toothed leaves and bears male catkins
